history.content:
eecs 126 

----------

please share why you think is better

children.subject: yes, I have heard that too. Have you taken cs182 or cs189? and if so, how confident do you feel?
I'm taking Stat 140 because Prof Adikhari is a fantastic professor

I am not particularly interested in grad school right now. I just want to explore the introductory machine learning world at cs189 and I want to prepare real good. I had a really bad time at cs70 so I need to re-enforce the topics. Many people take ee126 not only because they claim is more "complete," but also there is a certain bias in favor of taking hard undergrad classes. I have heard really good thing about 140 and it seems a more appropriate place to start. Do you know what other class I can take alongside 140 to help me to prepare more? some people say ee120 is good if i want to later explore image processing, or even ee127, which seems not to be as bad as ee126.

Prob 140 is one of my favourite classes at Berkeley, quite possibly my favourite. Professor Adhikari is *the* best professor I've had here, which is no mean feat. 126 might be the way to go if you're really interested in an AI/ML PhD and you want a class that covers both probability and stochastic processes, but it also entails a higher workload. Which one you decide to take depends on your specific circumstances, but I haven't heard anyone who's taken 140 feel like they weren't prepared for the level of probability that 189 entails

history.content: Really short question, if I plan to take cs189 next fall 2020, which one of this classes will likely help me for that. I heard that ee126 is the way to go, but I heard stat 140 has greater reputation and is more demanded.
history.subject: EE126 vs STAT 140
